content:
Prologue "No More Fear" 
This article records and summarizes the submissions I received from the daytime to 4 pm on November 26.
Throughout the day, influenced by Urumqi the night before, massive anti-zero movement broke out in various parts of the country and universities, with Beijing being the most frequent.
All this constituted the prelude to the white paper movement that night.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
November 26th was a long day, and so much happened across the country that I even had to break it up into chapters by the hour.
When I saw those tweets, I couldn't help but be pulled back by my emotions. Before this day, like many people, I pessimistically thought that maybe China would be completely cleared forever.
I hope that I can restore to everyone the experience of experiencing the live broadcast on that day as much as possible. â€¦

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
On Xiaohongshu, some netizens complained that the quality of drugs deteriorated after centralized procurement, which resonated with medical staff and patients in the comment area
It is reported that China is currently carrying out medical reform, and one of the important measures is to obtain most drugs through centralized procurement. However, due to insufficient medical insurance funds, in order to reduce drug prices, the country has adopted an open bidding method, usually selecting the pharmaceutical factory with the lowest bid as the winning bidder.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Currently, this content has been blocked.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Real-life melting pot
Recently, many domestic media reported that Liu, the principal of a special school in Suizhou, Hubei, sexually assaulted multiple disabled students for four years, and some students were under the age of 14 when they were first raped.
In May 2022, Liu was criminally detained. One month before his arrest, the China Disabled Persons' Federation reported on him under the title "Father of 500 People". In December 2022, the Sui County People's Court sentenced him to three years and six months in prison at first instance.
On June 17, 2023, the Sui County People's Court said it had set up a working group to review the case in its entirety.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
"Hell filter" further investigation
Some netizens pointed out that the BBC did use the so-called "hell filter" in its YouTube program, but many Chinese media including CCTV.com, Hubei Satellite TV, and The Paper also used this "filter".

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
On June 19, Jiangxi Normal University issued new regulations that fruits cannot be cut, leafy vegetables and commodities are restricted, and the Youth League Secretary is required to remind every student and remind them not to forward them online at will.
Some students speculated that it was affected by the "rat head and duck neck" incident.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
After the epidemic subsided, it became a common phenomenon for local governments in China to default on anti-epidemic subsidies for medical staff.
In areas where subsidies were issued, administrative personnel who did not participate in specific anti-epidemic work could receive the same subsidies as medical staff.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Netizen contribution
In 2023, a unit in Guangdong spent more than 50,000 yuan to subscribe to various newspapers and magazines, all of which were piled up in a corner and no one cared about them.
A netizen in the comment area said, "That book is the same."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Sichuan Vocational College of Science and Technology students collectively submitted an article
Recently, nearly 500 students from Sichuan Vocational College of Science and Technology collectively reported that the school illegally charged students 4,000-7,000 yuan for school-enterprise cooperation service fees (this fee was prohibited by the Ministry of Education in 2015). The school included this fee in the tuition fee range. Now it is known that students from 2017 to 2022 have been charged.
After the students collectively reported to the Education Department, some students received threats from unknown phone calls, asking them to be careful with their words.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Summary of previous tweets
This article summarizes the six hours from 4:00 p.m. to 11:30 p.m. on November 26, 2022, from the response of colleges and universities across the country from the teenagers holding white paper at Nanjing University of Media and Communication, to the city-wide protests that broke out in Lanzhou, Guangzhou, Altay, Aksu, Wuhan and other places.
Chapter 1: "Deafening in Silence" - White Paper Movement & National Anti-Dynamic Clearance Movement
